com.zebra.sdk.common.card.graphics

Interface ZebraGraphics

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ZebraGraphicsI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ZebraCardGraphics

    public interface ZebraGraphics
extends ZebraGraphicsI
    Interface for Zebra card printer graphics.

        clear, close, convertImageToRGB, createImage, drawImage, extractBlackImageData, initialize, rotateImage, rotateImage, setPrinterModel

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(int maxWidth,
              int maxHeight,
              OrientationType orientation,
              PrintType printType,
              java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Initializes the drawing surface.
        • If the specified maxWidth or maxHeight is 0 then the maximum values for the specified printer model will be used.
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - the maximum width of the image (limited based on printer model)
        maxHeight - the maximum height of the image (limited based on printer model)
        orientation - the orientation of the image.
        printType - the type of print to be performed for the given image data.
        fillColor - the RGB background fill color.

      • createImage

        ZebraCardImageI createImage(String colorProfileName)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Generates the final bitmap image.
        Parameters:
        colorProfileName - ICC profile to apply to the image.
        • 24bpp image format only.
        • Ignored if empty or null.
        Returns:
        ZebraCardImageI containing the bitmap image data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs creating the image.

      • drawLine

        void drawLine(int x1,
            int y1,
            int x2,
            int y2,
            float lineThickness,
            java.awt.Color lineColor)
        Draws a Line from the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the X coordinate of the start point
        y1 - the Y coordinate of the start point
        x2 - the X coordinate of the end point
        y2 - the Y coordinate of the end point
        lineThickness - the thickness of the line.
        lineColor - the RGB line color.

      • drawText

        void drawText(String text,
            int x,
            int y,
            int angle,
            java.awt.Color textColor)
        Draws the text at the specified x and y coordinates and center rotates the text to the specified angle
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be drawn.
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        angle - the angle of the the text to be drawn (center rotated).
        textColor - the RGB color of the text to be drawn.

      • drawText

        void drawText(String text,
            int x,
            int y,
            java.awt.Color textColor)
        Draws the text at the specified x and y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be drawn.
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        textColor - the RGB color of the text to be drawn.

      • drawText

        void drawText(String text,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height,
            int angle,
            java.awt.Color textColor)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Draws the text into the specified rectangle.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be drawn.
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        angle - the angle of the the text to be drawn (center rotated).
        textColor - the RGB color of the text to be drawn.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified width and height are not large enough to contain the text.

      • drawText

        void drawText(String text,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height,
            int angle,
            java.awt.Color textColor,
            boolean shrinkToFit)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Draws the text into the specified rectangle.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be drawn.
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        angle - the angle of the the text to be drawn.
        textColor - the RGB color of the text to be drawn.
        shrinkToFit - True to adjust the font size to fit the specified width and height.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified width and height are not large enough to contain the text and shrinkToFit is false.

      • drawText

        void drawText(String text,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height,
            int angle,
            TextAlignment horizontal,
            TextAlignment vertical,
            java.awt.Color textColor)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Draws the text into the specified rectangle.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be drawn.
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        angle - the angle of the the text to be drawn.
        horizontal - the horizontal alignment of the text.
        vertical - the vertical alignment of the text.
        textColor - the RGB color of the text to be drawn.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified width and height are not large enough to contain the text.

      • drawText

        void drawText(String text,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height,
            int angle,
            TextAlignment horizontal,
            TextAlignment vertical,
            java.awt.Color textColor,
            boolean shrinkToFit)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Draws the text into the specified rectangle.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be drawn.
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        angle - the angle of the the text to be drawn.
        horizontal - the horizontal alignment of the text.
        vertical - the vertical alignment of the text.
        textColor - the RGB color of the text to be drawn.
        shrinkToFit - true to adjust the font size to fit the specified width and height.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified width and height are not large enough to contain the text and shrinkToFit is false.

      • drawImage

        void drawImage(byte[] imageData,
             int x,
             int y,
             int width,
             int height,
             float transparency,
             RotationType rotation)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      IllegalArgumentException
        Draws the image into the specified rectangle.
        Parameters:
        imageData - the bitmap image data.
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        • If width is 0 then the width of the specified image will be used.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        • If height is 0 then the height of the specified image will be used
        transparency - the transparency level.
        • 0.0f = completely opaque
        • 100.0f = completely transparent
        rotation - the rotation type for the image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the image data.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified transparency level is outside of the valid range.

      • drawImage

        void drawImage(byte[] imageData,
             ImagePosition position,
             int width,
             int height,
             float transparency,
             RotationType rotation)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      IllegalArgumentException
        Draws the image at the specified image position in the rectangle.
        Parameters:
        imageData - the bitmap image data.
        position - the position of the image in the rectangle.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        • If width is 0 then the width of the specified image will be used.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        • If height is 0 then the height of the specified image will be used.
        transparency - the transparency level.
        • 0.0f = completely opaque
        • 100.0f = completely transparent
        rotation - the rotation type.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the image data.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified transparency level is outside of the valid range.

      • drawRectangle

        void drawRectangle(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 float lineThickness,
                 java.awt.Color lineColor,
                 java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Draws a rectangle at the specified coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        lineThickness - the line thickness of the rectangle.
        • the lineThickness will be ignored if the lineColor is null.
        lineColor - the RGB line color of the rectangle.
        • the lineColor will be ignored if null.
        fillColor - the RGB fill color of the rectangle.
        • the fillColor will be ignored if null.

      • drawRoundedRectangle

        void drawRoundedRectangle(int x,
                        int y,
                        int width,
                        int height,
                        float radius,
                        float lineThickness,
                        java.awt.Color lineColor,
                        java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Draws a round-cornered rectangle at the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        radius - the corner radius of the rectangle.
        lineThickness - the line thickness of the rectangle.
        • the lineThickness will be ignored if the lineColor is null.
        lineColor - the RGB line color of the rectangle.
        • the lineColor will be ignored if null.
        fillColor - the RGB fill color of the rectangle.
        • the fillColor will be ignored if null.

      • drawEllipse

        void drawEllipse(int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height,
               int lineThickness,
               java.awt.Color lineColor,
               java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Draws an ellipse at the specified coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of the ellipse.
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of the ellipse.
        width - the width of the ellipse.
        height - the height of the ellipse.
        lineThickness - the line thickness of the rectangle.
        • the lineThickness will be ignored if the lineColor is null.
        lineColor - the RGB line color of the rectangle.
        • the lineColor will be ignored if null.
        fillColor - the RGB fill color of the rectangle.
        • the fillColor will be ignored if null.

      • cropImage

        byte[] cropImage(byte[] imageData,
               int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Crops an image to supplied dimensions and returns the cropped image data.
        Parameters:
        imageData - byte[] containing the raw bitmap data.
        x - the x-offset of new image.
        y - the y-offset of new image.
        Returns:
        byte[] containing the cropped image data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the image data.

      • monochromeConversionType

        void monochromeConversionType(MonochromeConversion type)
        Sets the monochrome conversion type to be used during createImage(String).
        • Valid for ribbon types of 1bpp and 8bpp only.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of monochrome conversion to perform.

      • setBrightnessLevel

        void setBrightnessLevel(int level)
        Sets the brightness correction level to be applied during createImage(String)
        Parameters:
        level - the brightness level.
        • Range: -25 to 25

      • setContrastLevel

        void setContrastLevel(int level)
        Sets the contrast correction level to be applied during createImage(String)
        Parameters:
        level - the contrast level.
        • Range: -25 to 25

      • setGammaLevel

        void setGammaLevel(int level)
        Sets the gamma correction level to be applied during createImage(String)
        Parameters:
        level - the gamma level.
        • Range: -25 to 25

      • setSaturationLevel

        void setSaturationLevel(int level)
        Sets the saturation correction level to be applied during createImage(String)
        Parameters:
        level - the saturation correction level.
        • Range: -25 to 25

      • setColorScale

        void setColorScale(int red,
                 int green,
                 int blue)
        Sets the color scale correction values for red, green, and blue pixel values during createImage(String)
        Parameters:
        red - the red pixel correction value.
        green - the green pixel correction value.
        blue - the blue pixel correction value.
        • Range: -25 to 25

      • setFont

        void setFont(java.awt.Font font)
        Sets the font type to be used during drawText operations.
        Parameters:
        font - the font of the text to be drawn.

      • setRenderingHints

        void setRenderingHints(java.awt.RenderingHints renderingHints)
        Adds to the RenderingHints to be used during draw operations.
        Parameters:
        renderingHints - the rendering hints.

      • imageToImageData

        byte[] imageToImageData(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Converts a BufferedImage into it's raw image data
        Parameters:
        image - the BufferedImage.
        Returns:
        the raw image data from the specified buffered image.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the image is invalid.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the image data.

      • imageDataToImage

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageDataToImage(byte[] imageData)
                                              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                     java.io.IOException
        Creates a BufferedImage object from the raw bitmap data.
        Parameters:
        imageData - the raw bitmap data.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage generated from the specified image data
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the imageData is invalid.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the image data.
